item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 9, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. LIMO: Less Is More for Reasoning (120 points | 53 comments)
2. Persistent packages on Steam Deck using Nix (43 points | 20 comments)
3. Don't "optimize" conditional moves in shaders with mix()+step() (249 points | 104 comments)
4. AI Demos by Meta (24 points | 21 comments)

6. PhD Knowledge Not Required: A Reasoning Challenge for Large Language Models (29 points | 22 comments)

8. Teen on Musk's DOGE team graduated from 'The Com' (261 points | 164 comments)
9. 3D reconstruction of the capital of the Aztec empire (237 points | 54 comments)
10. Rwandan scientists develop local yeast for banana wine-makers (95 points | 48 comments)
11. Baffled by generational garbage collection – wingolog (82 points | 51 comments)
12. Kanata: Cross-platform multi-layer keyboard remapper with advanced customization (78 points | 27 comments)
13. Ada crate of the year 2024 announced (4 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: My first side project, streamlined book clubs on Slack (74 points | 35 comments)
15. Classic Data science pipelines built with LLMs (132 points | 72 comments)
16. Daily omega-3 fatty acids may help human organs stay young (25 points | 5 comments)
17. Intel ruined an Israeli startup it bought for $2B–and lost the AI race (25 points | 10 comments)

20. HTML Kaleidoscope (25 points | 11 comments)
21. Linux as co-operative Windows process (2017) (78 points | 50 comments)
22. Why Blog If Nobody Reads It? (98 points | 62 comments)
23. Pirates and Privateers – Superstitions and the Sea (2007) (8 points | discuss)
24. Grafana: Why observability needs FinOps, and vice versa (4 points | 1 comment)
25. Advanced Magnet Manufacturing Begins in the United States (9 points | discuss)
26. Emergence of collective oscillations in human crowds (75 points | 37 comments)
27. RetroFab: Playable 3D simulations of vintage electronic games (125 points | 19 comments)
28. Jacksonpollock.org (2003) (472 points | 127 comments)
29. Mathematics in the 20th century, by Michael Atiyah [pdf] (2002) (94 points | 14 comments)
30. Moving Power Grids in a Weekend, the Baltic States Make the Switch (3 points | discuss)
